definition: a flat structure (as of wood) for support or transportation on water, an inflatable flat-bottomed watercraft
examples: "How shall we cross the river?" asked Dorothy. "That is easily done," replied the Scarecrow. "The Tin Woodman must build us a raft, so we can float to the other side." So the Woodman took his axe and began to chop down small trees to make a raft …
… has made a living poling a raft on the Suchiate for two decades …
In addition to a gorgeous 400' long sandy beach with a swim raft, there are 44 boat docks which are licensed to individual … homeowners.
Finally, the three astronauts, wearing their isolation garments, clambered out of the spacecraft into a rubber raft.
All my fishing gear, which sometimes included an inflatable raft, went into a backpack so that my hands would be free to carry my shotgun.

definition: a collection of logs or timber fastened together in order to be floated downstream (as to a sawmill)
examples: Soviet loggers commonly float individual logs down rivers to sawmills, rather than lashing them together in rafts.

Home sites and hunting vantage points would have been undercut by the waves, salt meadows would have become angry shallow seas, and bitter salt and rafts of sea ice would have killed the willow brush and rich sedge meadows of the river deltas.
— William W. Fitzburg and Aron Crowell

definition: an aggregation of animals (such as waterfowl) resting on the water
to transport by means of a raft (see raft entry 1 sense 1a)
examples: Lewis was rafting supplies cross river … when he dumped his raft, soaking his chronometer.

definition: to transport in the form of a raft (see raft entry 1 sense 1b)
examples: … the logs which had been floating in them were swept down the river to the sea before being rafted away to the sawmills.

definition: to convey (something, such as pebbles) in floating ice or masses of organic material
examples: … sediment deposits are dominated by rock fragments released by melting ice. Even large rocks are rafted out and then released as the ice melts.

definition: to travel along or across (a river or other body of water) on a raft
examples: Although the writing is somewhat pedestrian, river rats will enjoy the 27 accounts … of rafting rivers in 11 Western states.
